item.description:
Winter Saturdays in Boston are a good time enjoy our local cultural gems.  Fashioned after and Italian Villa, the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum has a rich history in Boston.  Rumor has it that the great lady herself was a wild woman......but that's just a rumor.

Aside from that, the exhibits are fascinating and the glass-domed courtyard garden is a refreshing escape from this cold season.

The museum admission is $15.00.  Most local libraries offer passes with reduced museum admission prices.

http://www.gardnermuseum.org/home/

After our time at the museum, we can head down to Fire and Ice at 205 Berkeley Street in the Back Bay.  Fire and Ice is a fun, eclectic, entertaining and delicious interacive restaurant experience.

The all-you-can-eat price is $16.95, drinks and desserts are additional charges.

Our late lunch/early dinner reservation at Fire and Ice is at 4:00pm

http://www.fire-ice.com/locations/boston-ma/
item.how_to_find_us: Main entrance at 2:30. I will arrive at 2:15 to greet guests.

group.name: Boston Baby Boomers Meetup Group-Social Fun

item.name: Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum Followed by Dinner at Fire and Ice
